physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady. She is sitting down and looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. She is dressed in her ethnic costume, and she is resting her left shoulder on a round table. Betel chewing paraphernalia is placed on the table.
sgcool_label_text:
This studio portrait shows a nyonya posing beside a table and a sireh set. This photograph was probably taken by G.R. Lambert and Co.

G.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert, who was originally from Dresden, Germany. Popular among the elites, the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.
subject_terms_1: studio portraits women (female humans) Peranakan folk costume
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Women Ethnic costume Betel chewing paraphernalia Peranakan (Asian people)
